chunks.lyrics: *I was playing along with this song, and it's definently tuned down to Db.
*The solo is almost dead on. It's typical sweeps that Syn always uses.
*The only part I'm missing is the Rhythm Guitar for the first half
of the solo. So if anybody knows what the Rhythm Guitar Chords are during
the first half, then e-mail me the tab, or leave it in the comments of this
tab. Make sure you tab it out in Db Ab Db Gb Bb Eb.
I fixed up this tab. I fixed the "Pre Chorus" part, and I
made the solo much easier. I also fixed the interlude after the
solo, because the chords were way off. The rhythm for the intro,
and during the 2nd half solo, are fixed also. I still don't have
the rhythm guitar during the first half solo, but some of you
guys have given me some good versions of that, but I'm not sure
This is all still tabbed out by ear.
Tuning: Drop D, down half step (Db Ab Db Gb Bb Eb) (low to high) (For all Guitars)
Key: F Major (F G A Bb C D E F)
x = muffled string (lightly mute with your fret hand)
1.5 = one and a half step bend
*The numbers above the b's are the steps you bend that note.*
Intro: Bend all of the bends slowly. Syn might be pushing down the wammy bar lightly
or he's just releasing the bend slowly. Either way works.
Guitar 2: Listen for rhythm. Play this twice over the intro.
Guitars 1 and 2: Listen for rhythm. These are the only two chords used in the chorus.
Strum each chord a certain number of times, listen to the song for it.
End the chorus with this little part:
Guitars 1 and 2: Listen for rhythm of first two chords.
End the chorus with this little part:
Solo: I don't know what Guitar 2 is doing in the backround of this part.
End of First Half of Solo.
Guitar 2: Play this twice during the above part ^ ^ ^.
Interlude: This is the whole part after the solo.
Guitars 1 and 2: Listen for the rhythm of each chord.
Hit the 3/5/5 chord at the end once.
Guitar 2: use a wah pedal as a filter, or just turn your volume
knob on your guitar half way down for a little bit of distortion.
Guitar 1: Hit the first chord once. Listen for timing.
Guitars 1 and 2: Listen for rhythm of the first two chords.
End the chorus with this little part:
Please Comment and Rate this tab.
